title: William Sunsing
text:
William Sunsing Hidalgo (born 12 May 1977) is a <a href="Costa%20Rica">Costa Rica</a>n bodybuilder and former <a href="association%20football">football</a> player.
Association football career.
Club career.
The dreadlocked Sunsing made his professional debut for played for <a href="C.S.%20Herediano">Herediano</a> on 5 April 1995 against <a href="A.D.%20San%20Carlos">San Carlos</a> and scored his first goal on 5 March 1997 for <a href="Asociaci%C3%B3n%20Deportiva%20Ramonense">Ramonense</a> against Saprissa. A much-travelled winger, he played abroad for <a href="New%20England%20Revolution">New England Revolution</a> in the <a href="United%20States">United States</a>, <a href="FK%20Teplice">FK Teplice</a> in the <a href="Czech%20Republic">Czech Republic</a> and <a href="Akratitos">Akratitos</a> in Greece where he played alongside compatriots <a href="Froyl%C3%A1n%20Ledezma">Froylán Ledezma</a> and <a href="Berny%20Pe%C3%B1a">Berny Peña</a>. He also played for <a href="Deportivo%20Saprissa">Deportivo Saprissa</a>, <a href="A.D.%20Santa%20B%C3%A1rbara">Santa Bárbara</a> and <a href="Municipal%20P%C3%A9rez%20Zeled%C3%B3n">Pérez Zeledón</a> in Costa Rica. He was nicknamed "The Menace" during his trip through <a href="Major%20League%20Soccer">Major League Soccer</a>.
In summer 2007 <a href="Brujas%20F.C.">Brujas</a> sold Sunsing to <a href="Municipal%20Liberia">Liberia Mía</a> where he signed for three years.
He joined <a href="Limon%20F.C.">Limón</a> in December 2010, but left them in summer 2011 after falling out with manager Ronald Mora. He later left <a href="Ori%C3%B3n%20F.C.">Orión</a> in September 2011 due to financial problems at the club which allowed him to move abroad to play in Guatemala for <a href="Cob%C3%A1n%20Imperial">Cobán Imperial</a>. His final club was Guatemala second division outfit <a href="Club%20Social%20y%20Deportivo%20Sayaxch%C3%A9">Sayaxché</a> after <a href="Club%20Xelaj%C3%BA%20MC">Xelajú</a> were unable to lure him away from Cobán.
Sunsing retired on 7 December 2012, after amassing 352 Costa Rica Primera División matches in which he scored 76 goals.
International career.
Sunsing made his debut for <a href="Costa%20Rica%20national%20football%20team">Costa Rica</a> in a January 2000 <a href="friendly%20match">friendly match</a> against <a href="Trinidad%20and%20Tobago%20national%20football%20team">Trinidad & Tobago</a> and earned a total of 35 caps, scoring 4 goals. He represented his country in 18 <a href="FIFA%20World%20Cup%20qualification">FIFA World Cup qualification</a> matches and was a non-playing squad member at the <a href="2002%20FIFA%20World%20Cup">2002 FIFA World Cup</a> and the <a href="2001%20Copa%20Am%C3%A9rica">2001 Copa América</a>. He scored the only goal in the only ever match the "Ticos" won over Jamaica, in 2001.
He also played at the <a href="2000%20CONCACAF%20Gold%20Cup">2000</a> and <a href="2002%20CONCACAF%20Gold%20Cup">2002 CONCACAF Gold Cup</a>s.
His final international was a September 2009 <a href="FIFA%20World%20Cup%20qualification">FIFA World Cup qualification</a> match against <a href="El%20Salvador%20national%20football%20team">El Salvador</a>.
Bodybuilding career.
In 2019, Sunsing made his debut as a bodybuilder.
Personal life.
Sunsing is married to Ivannia Quesada and has a daughter, Keylin.
